image.altText: A middle-aged Sri Lankan woman in glasses speaks into a microphone, with a sign reading 'Sri Lanka'

props.synopsis: The worker was paid $11,212 for roughly three years of work as a domestic worker at the Sri Lankan High Commissioner's residence in Canberra.

title.children: Diplomat's employee paid 65c hourly wins $117,000 in court

image.altText: A apartment building with cars driving on a main road in the foreground.

props.synopsis: CoreLogic data for 2024 shows house prices in Canberra are the third highest in the country, behind Sydney and Brisbane, and continue to track upwards. Â

title.children: The ACT's priciest and cheapest suburbs, according to CoreLogic

image.altText: A statue of a man and a donkey suspended in the air outside the Australian War Memorial.

props.synopsis: It's hoped visitors will now be more easily able to interact with the sculpture, and even pat the donkey.

title.children: Iconic sculpture returns to Australian War Memorial for visitors to pat

image.altText: Split cherries amongst leaves.

props.synopsis: The country's two largest cherry producing states lose a third of their fruit due to heavy rain, which could see prices rise.

title.children: Rain-hit cherries 'explode' in several states, slashing Christmas supply

image.altText: An Asian-Australian man smiling as he works with fabric to create an artwork.

props.synopsis: I never knew the chemicals in my brain were responsible for the cycle of burnout and shame that had consumed me. Turns out, I'm not the only one.

title.children: 'Life on hard mode': This is what it's like to be diagnosed with ADHD

image.altText: A museum exhibit with projections on the wall and artefacts in the middle.

props.synopsis: The Pompeii exhibition at the National Museum uses immersive audiovisual elements alongside artefacts to show attendees what life may have been like.

title.children: Exhibition shows Pompeii before and after volcano erupts

image.altText: Bruce Lehrmann walking into court.

props.synopsis: An indictment alleging Bruce Lehrmann raped a woman in Queensland in October 2021 has been presented to the Toowoomba District Court.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann alleged rape indictments presented to court

image.altText: Bucket of brown, murky water sitting under an outdoor tap. It looks disgusting.

props.synopsis: The last upgrade of the Yass Valley's water treatment plant was in 1990, with residents dealing with ongoing issues with the quality of their water.

title.children: Water upgrades coming for region where most won't drink from the tap

image.altText: Australia captain Pat Cummins tosses the coin alongside India captain Rohit Sharma before the third Test at the Gabba.

props.synopsis: Overcast skies welcome Australia and India to Brisbane for the third Border-Gavaskar Test at the Gabba, with Josh Hazlewood returning from injury. Follow live.

title.children: India sends Australia in to bat under cloudy skies at the Gabba

image.altText: A man wearing a cap, silver aviator sunglasses and a tan-coloured hat smiles in a selfie, with white and tan roofs behind him

props.synopsis: A UK coroner has ruled that Daniel Burke died after being shot multiple times while unarmed in Ukraine, with the inquest told an Australian-Algerian dual national had confessed to his death.

title.children: Australian a suspect in 'unlawful killing' of ex-UK soldier in Ukraine

image.altText: Luigi Mangione wears an orange prison suit and is followed by a law enforcement officer.

props.synopsis: Luigi Mangione, the man charged with the murder of a UnitedHealthcare CEO, was not a customer of the health insurer it reveals, as parent company makes its first public comments.Â

title.children: Health insurer says Luigi Mangione wasn't a client amid copycat arrest

image.altText: A man and a woman in formal wear walk through soldiers in gold hats featuring plumes

props.synopsis: The Syrian regime was also one of the world's biggest drug syndicates. What happens to the multi-billion-dollar drug trade now that the "narco-state" has fallen?

title.children: Uncertainty swirls around tiny pill that reanimated Syria's zombie economy

image.altText: Prince Andrew stands outside Westminster Abbey at the thanksgiving service for Prince Philip.

props.synopsis: A statement from Andrew's office said that the Duke of York had "followed advice" from the government and "ceased all contact with the individual after concerns were raised".

title.children: Prince Andrew says he 'ceased all contact' with suspected Chinese spy

image.altText: Proxy woman out front of house

title.children: The 'mad or bad woman trope' devastating victims of domestic violence

image.altText: A footpath next to a road tapped of by police tape.

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to bushland in Sir Joseph Banks Park in Botany after a member of the public found a woman's body about 7am on Monday.

title.children: Body of woman found near Sydney Airport identified

image.altText: A farmer being examined by two health workers.

props.synopsis:
Finding time to visit the GP can often be difficult for farmers, but in country Victoria, nurses are bringing healthcare directly to them by running free monthly medical clinics at the saleyards, and itâs proving very popular with the community.Â

title.children: Farmers rarely see their GP so healthcare is going directly to the saleyards

image.altText: A yellow Hezbollah flag, featuring an arm reaching up to a rifle, seen above a sea of people.

title.children: Melbourne man charged over displaying Hezbollah flag at rally

image.altText: A woman in a lab coat holding a petridish

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed a cost-effective wound treatment, which uses the Indigenous bush remedy lemon myrtle oil as a key ingredient.Â

title.children: Researchers turn bush remedy into 'life changing' wound treatment

image.altText: A wine glass with swirling red wine against a mountainous dusk backdrop

props.synopsis: Travel by cable car up to alpine vineyards so beautiful Prince wrote a song about them, in a place that keeps the best wines all to itself.

image.altText: An artisan makes traditional West Javanese puppets called wayang

props.synopsis: An elite school will soon ditch a long-running language program, in a move experts say could be "ideological" and will leave Australia ill-equipped to engage with our closest Asian neighbour.

image.altText: She sits by the ocean wearing a blazer and holding a photograph of her dad, who is wearing a wetsuit and has white hair

props.synopsis: Rural communities fear the high cost of asbestos removal puts the public at risk, as uninsured home owners fail to clean up the deadly material after house fires.Â

title.children: A silent scourge, asbestos is proving hard for country towns to get rid of

image.altText: A smiling mum and dad holding their small baby.

props.synopsis: Ocie Ni Dheasmhunaigh has a form of dwarfism so extremely rare, she's one of only three known cases in Australia. The "happy little girl" recently underwent surgery to avoid pain later in life.

title.children: Ocie's rare form of dwarfism was diagnosed soon after her first birthday

image.altText: Paul Bartlett crouching down with a group of labradoodles.

props.synopsis: The RSPCA is investigating if criminal charges are possible for the former owners of Tasmania's largest puppy farm, in the wake of an ABC report that aired concerns from former workers.

title.children: RSPCA takes steps to pursue Tasmanian Labradoodles owners for new charges

image.altText: A woman and man wearing wide-brimmed hats and sunglasses at the top of a range, sparse trees and yellowed grass behind them.

props.synopsis: More than 50 Pioneer Valley residents have the option to buy their properties back from Queensland Hydro after its energy storage project was cancelled.

title.children: Landowners who sold up for pumped hydro project offered buybacks

image.altText: An explosion in the sky is seen above Kyiv after a drone is intercepted.

props.synopsis: The Kremlin says the strikes on Ukraine's power stations and transmission lines are in response to the firing of US-made missiles at a Russian air base.

title.children: Russian drones, cruise missiles batter Ukraine's energy grid

image.altText: Hornsy plan graphic with Parramatta Westfield tower plan and Westfield logo under microscope together in graphic

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest shopping centre operators is exploring whether it can build apartments on 42 of its shopping centres. But while some claim this could help the affordable housing crisis, others have reservations.

title.children: Would apartments on a shopping centre solve the housing crisis?

image.altText: Blurred shot of people walking through a neon-lit street at night

props.synopsis: Thai media reports say the boy was found at the steps of a shop in Pattaya where he had collapsed with a knife blade in his back.

image.altText: crisafulli speaking during question time

props.synopsis: No issue proved more of a headache for David Crisafulli on the election campaign trail than abortion, writes Jack McKay.Â

title.children: Queensland premier reveals unorthodox solution to his abortion issue

image.altText: A man with a moustache smiles inside a car

title.children: This man is using TikTok to help others beat loneliness this Christmas

image.altText: Connor McKinney of Australia plays his first shot on the 1st hole, in his follow through

image.altText: FIA president Mohammed Ben Sulayem is seen before the race looking over a pit wall before a race

props.synopsis: Formula 1 has not raced in Africa since the last South African Grand Prix was held at Kyalami, north of Johannesburg, in 1993.

title.children: F1's return to Africa a step closer, governing body approves ethics change

image.altText: Two glass jars filled with Eton mess ready for serving for Christmas dessert, with passionfruit curd, strawberries and mint.

props.synopsis: Pavlova is considered a classic dessert for summer celebrations, but Eton mess is a cooler, less fussy option.Â

image.altText: An illustration of a glowing yellow sun and people floating among stacks of books

props.synopsis: Here's our wrap of the best books of 2024. Novels by Sally Rooney, Tim Winton and Booker Prize winner Samantha Harvey top our critics' favourite reads of the year.
